intro: Platea excelsa var. kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Kinabalu platea, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in montane rainforests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, often with a distinct midrib, and it produces white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
